page.title: 06CONSERVATION
page.content: People who are interested in {conservation}try to keep the land as it would be naturally where animals and{rare plants}are{protected.}The need for{conservation}in this area is because the farmers are{breaking}in land which means they make heathland {arable}by burning,clearing stones and ploughing.{Hedges}are also being removed to make fields larger and this {destroys habitats.}Insecticides and chemicals are being used and can affect wildlife. The{quarry}also affects the wildlife by blasting away the rock and {destroying}the surrounding{heathland. To prevent this happening the{Nature {Conservancy Council}tries to buy the heathlands and create{nature reserves} where the rare plants and animals can live undisturbed.
